intro: Stenanthemum sublineare, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stenanthemum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are arranged in opposite pairs along the stems. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and thrives in coastal and inland regions. Stenanthemum sublineare is an important component of local flora and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
